most_expensive_block: The two-day TATA Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 Player Auction concluded after setting the cash registers and record registers ringing at Abadi Al Johar Arena in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. Wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant, member of India’s historic 2024 ICC T20 World Cup-winning team, was picked by Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) for a whopping INR 27 Crore as he became the most expensive player in the history of the TATA IPL Auction, pipping Shreyas Iyer, who joined PBKS for a staggering INR 26.75 Crore. 13-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi, who was brought on board by Rajasthan Royals (RR) for INR 1.1 Crore, became the youngest ever cricketer to have been picked by an IPL franchise. The 10 franchises bought 182 players, including 62 overseas players amongst themselves and used as many as 8 Right To Match, spending INR 639.15 Crore in total offering the players the possible opportunities to rub shoulders with some of the finest of the game.
